body_html:
I looked into the code. How it works now:

  • Only users with the roles Admin and Supervisor can see emails and timezones of other users.
  • The checkbox "Never show my email address" doesn't do anything (probably because there is no need in it, see the previous statement).

When easiest thing I could do it to show emails and timezones to all confirmed users, if the checkbox "Never show" is false, and to nobody if the checkbox is true. But I don't think that this is the right thing to do. At least, there should be roles which see email addresses regardless the hide_email value (admins, orga, supervisors?).

@alicetragedy what do you think? How should it work?

body:
I looked into the code. How it works now:
 * Only users with the roles Admin and Supervisor can see emails and timezones of other users.
 * The checkbox "Never show my email address" doesn't do anything (probably because there is no need in it, see the previous statement).

When easiest thing I could do it to show emails and timezones to *all* confirmed users, if the checkbox "Never show" is false, and to *nobody* if the checkbox is true. But I don't think that this is the right thing to do. At least, there should be roles which see email addresses regardless the `hide_email` value (admins, orga, supervisors?). 

@alicetragedy what do you think? How should it work?
